1.brief: to be or come (causatively, bring) near (for any purpose); euphemistically, to lie with a woman; as an enemy, to attack; religious to worship; causatively, to present; figuratively, to adduce an argument; by reversal, to stand back
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
a Levite or descendant of Levi
near, with or among; often in general, to
Elazar, the name of seven Israelites
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Nun or Non, the father of Joshua
near, with or among; often in general, to
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

2.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Kenaan, a son a Ham; also the country inhabited by him
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a suburb (i.e. open country whither flocks are driven from pasture); hence, the area around abuilding, or the margin of the sea
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
